problem_text:
21.70. A group G is called an orientable Poincaré duality group of dimension n over a ring R if it is of type FP over R and Hi(G; RG) = 0 for i ≠ n, while Hn(G; RG) = R as an RG-module, where the action on R is trivial. (Note that G is not required to be finitely presented.) If G is an orientable Poincaré duality group of dimension n over all fields, is it an orientable Poincaré duality group over the integers?
D. Kielak
